emuInput.TitMainTitle: Dancers, singers, and entertainers including Mamie Hamilton and Gwendolyn Hamilton in first row, James Smith, Juanita Yet, James Coles, Velma Woodbury Carey, Ethel Childs, Floyd Rawlings in middle row, and John Wanamaker, Marcella Wilson, Letitia Goode, Stanley Tucker, Harriet Courar in rear, gathered for Dilettantes group program in Centre Avenue YMCA with Henry O. Tanner painting "Christ and His Mother" on wall
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 21, 1946, pg. 16, reads: "Dilettantes Entertain Local Celebrities - The Dilettantes, an interracial group interested in cultural development, entertained a delegation of visitors at their meeting held at the Centre Avenue Branch YMCA Friday evening, Sept. 13... Center picture shows members of the Dilettantes who presented a program of ballet dancing, interpretive dancing and vocal selections. Back row: John Wanamaker, Marcella Wilson, Letitia Goode, Stanley Tucker, Harriet Courar. Middle row: James Smith, Juanita Yet, James Coles, Velma Woodbury Carey, Ethel Childs, Floyd Rawlings. Front row: Hamilton sisters... - Harris Photo."
